description:
Currently the order of functions in mock is wrong, so
we should change it.
title: To correct the using of mock in test case.

comments.content:
Currently the order of functions in mock is wrong, so
we should change it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~lianghuifei830

comments.content:
This bug report doesn't describe a failure in the behavior of Nova. 
It's a personal todo item which doesn't need the overhead of a bug 
report. Because of this, I'm closing this report as invalid. This 
shouldn't stop you though to do your item and push it as a review.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/260762
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/260762
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=ce9125b314500b1117840c90c5eb2210fec78485
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit ce9125b314500b1117840c90c5eb2210fec78485
Author: lianghuifei <lianghuifei830@126.com>
Date:   Sat Dec 19 06:51:28 2015 -0800

    Unreference mocks are listed in the wrong order
    
    There are a couple of policy checks where mocks are used to allow the
    checks to complete. The mocks aren't referenced later. However they
    are listed in the wrong order. While this doesn't impact this test
    directly, it is confusing, and may confuse people down the road trying
    to build tests based on this one.
    
    Change-Id: Idd1da91fe8d8b1e20bef469ef67728610a9ac3c1
    Closes-Bug: #1527881
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: This issue was fixed in the openstack/nova 13.0.0.0b2 development milestone.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
